meanings.definition: To set free from imprisonment or confinement.
meanings.sent1: The hero managed to liberate the prisoners from the dark dungeon.
meanings.sent2: The activists worked tirelessly to liberate the innocent hostages from captivity.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to liberate the rabbits from the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her music had the power to liberate the audience from their worries.
meanings.sent5: The key to happiness is to liberate yourself from negative thoughts.

meanings.definition: To release from oppression or domination.
meanings.sent1: The revolution aimed to liberate the people from the tyrannical regime.
meanings.sent2: The new laws were designed to liberate the citizens from unjust rulers.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to liberate the city from the evil villain's control.
meanings.sent4: Education has the ability to liberate minds from ignorance.
meanings.sent5: The power of knowledge can liberate individuals from mental chains.

meanings.definition: To free from control or restriction.
meanings.sent1: The new technology will liberate us from manual labor.
meanings.sent2: The artist's creativity knows no bounds, liberating her from artistic constraints.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain shower liberates the children from their scheduled activities.
meanings.sent4: Traveling to new places can liberate you from your comfort zone.
meanings.sent5: Learning to forgive can liberate you from the burden of anger.
